intro: Hieracium colobanthum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has narrow, elongated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium colobanthum is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
